channel.title: Hest
channel.itunes:author: Ivan Reese
channel.description: Ivan Reese thinks out loud about the design of his esoteric graphical programming system.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Ivan Reese thinks out loud about the design of his esoteric graphical programming system.

item.title: 1 • Graphical Programming
item.itunes:title: Graphical Programming
item.itunes:subtitle: The term Visual Programming is a bit of a misnomer. My preference is Graphical Programming, though it is hard to overcome cultural inertia. Oh, also, welcome to the show.

item.title: 2 • Why?
item.itunes:title: Why?
item.itunes:subtitle: Why am I making Hest? Who is it for? When did I start? When will it end? What is it now? Where is it going? And what of this podcast?

item.title: 3 • Waterslide Kid
item.itunes:title: Waterslide Kid
item.itunes:subtitle: Functions and data, conveyance, points and edges, and execution with a mandatory, explicit notion of time and space.

item.title: 4 • Giant Thumb
item.itunes:title: Giant Thumb
item.itunes:subtitle: Grab the giant thumb, push it all the way to infinity at the top, or negative infinity at the bottom.

item.title: 5 • The Space
item.itunes:title: The Space
item.itunes:subtitle: Fully explore the space of your designs, even if it makes you into an infamous grump. Also, I sometimes make up jargon like Graphical Programming, and today we have another: Participatory Execution. Finally, Wallace & Gromit have their long-awaited debut on the show.

item.title: 6 • No Moon
item.itunes:title: No Moon
item.itunes:subtitle: Virtual edges and pocket dimensions might be key pieces of a workable approach to abstraction, something that Hest sorely lacks.

item.title: 7 • Focus Mode
item.itunes:title: Focus Mode
item.itunes:subtitle: Data as player character. Continuity and intimacy. The well of video games. Putting your finger on the data and following it from birth to death. A patchwork quilt of understanding, versus a single continuous thread.
item.description: Data as player character. Continuity and intimacy. The well of video games. Putting your finger on the data and following it from birth to death. A patchwork quilt of understanding, versus a single continuous thread.
